C:/Users/Deepak/Projects/EvolveNetworks/GA/proteinInteractionNetwork.h

00001 /********************************************************************************************************
00002 
00003 Copyright (C) 2009 Deepak Chandran
00004 
00005         This file defines a chemical reaction network where each protein can switch from active to inactive form
00006         via Michaelis Menten type kinetics. The number of enzymes affecting each transition can be many.
00007 
00008         Example reaction:
00009                 A --> A';  rate = vmax1 * A * P1 / (Km1 + A)
00010                 A' --> A;  rate = vmax2 * (total - A)  * P2 /(Km2 + (total - A) )
00011  
00012         The functions in this file are designed to be used with the GA library that I have written. 
00013         
00014         This file defines the following functions that are required in the GA:
00015                 1) a struct that represents an "individual"
00016                 2) a mutation function to randomly alter an individual
00017                 3) a crossover function to make a new individual from two individuals
00018         
00019         In addition, the file defines:
00020                 1) ODE function to simulate a network
00021                 2) Propensity function to simulate a network stochastically
00022         
00023         The program using this file must define:
00024                 1) a function that returns the fitness of a network
00025                 
00026 *********************************************************************************************************/
00027 
00028 #include <stdio.h>
00029 #include <stdlib.h>
00030 #include <math.h>
00031 #include "ga.h"
00032 #include "mtrand.h"
00033 #include "cvodesim.h"   //for ODE simulation
00034 #include "ssa.h"        //for stochastic simulation
00035 
00036 #ifndef PROTEIN_INTERACTION_NETWORK_FOR_GA
00037 #define PROTEIN_INTERACTION_NETWORK_FOR_GA
00038 
00042 typedef struct
00043 {
00044         int size;
00045         int * proteins; //index (equivalent to name) of each regulator
00046         double * Km;  //Michaelis-Menten constant for each regulator
00047         double * Vmax;  //Vmax for each regulator. Negative Vmax means negative regulator
00048 }
00049 Regulators;
00050 
00054 typedef struct
00055 {
00056         int species;
00057         double * totals; //the total concentration of each protein
00058         Regulators * regulators; //the set of regulators for each protein
00059 } 
00060 ProteinInteractionNetwork;
